thread.title: BRIEF-Zuckerberg says Facebook deletions not a 'meaningful number'

title: BRIEF-Zuckerberg says Facebook deletions not a 'meaningful number'
text: March 22, 2018 / 2:07 AM / Updated an hour ago BRIEF-Zuckerberg says Facebook deletions not a 'meaningful number' Reuters Staff 1 Min Read March 21 (Reuters) - Facebook Inc Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg spoke on Wednesday to the New York Times and to Wired Magazine. * CEO MARK ZUCKERBERG SAYS HE HAS NOT SEEN A “MEANINGFUL NUMBER OF PEOPLE” DELETING ACCOUNTS -NYT * ZUCKERBERG SAYS FACEBOOK NEEDS TO STAY “VERY CHEAP OR FREE”; “I DON’T THINK THE AD MODEL IS GOING TO GO AWAY” -NYT * ZUCKERBERG SAYS FACEBOOK HAS FOUND NO LINK BETWEEN CAMBRIDGE ANALYTICA DATA AND RUSSIA’S INTERNET RESEARCH AGENCY -WIRED MAGAZINE * ZUCKERBERG SAYS U.S. GOVERNMENT IN BEST POSITION TO INVESTIGATE POSSIBLE LINK; GOVERNMENT HAS GIVEN FACEBOOK “WARRANTS” -WIRED Further company coverage: (Reporting By David Ingram)
